abstract: The liberal news and talk radio network has won bankruptcy court approval to sell its assets at an auction Friday.
snippet: The liberal news and talk radio network has won bankruptcy court approval to sell its assets at an auction Friday.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Feb. 12 (Dow Jones/AP)  Air America Radio, the liberal news and talk radio network, has won bankruptcy court approval to sell its assets at an auction Friday, starting with a $4.25 million bid from a consortium of purchasers formed by Stephen L. Green, the chairman of SL Green Realty of New York.

headline.main: Auction Is Set for Air America
headline.print_headline: Auction Is Set For Air America
